item.title: Manage dotfiles with GNU Stow
item.description: I use GNU stow to manage all the important dotfiles. Instructions Create a repo called dotfiles in your $HOME directory Recreate the directory structure for the files you want to manage as subdir(s) of that directory. mkdir -p ~/.dotfiles/bash mv ~/.bashrc ~/.bash_logout ~/.dotfiles/bash cd ~/.dotfiles stow bash Stow will create symlink for each file. .bashrc -> dotfiles/bash/.bashrc DonÂ´t forget to add this file to your git repo. Commit and push to remote and your done.
